Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Jenkinsfile pipeline" (#2603) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Plan is to move the xamarin-android build to a pipeline build.  Purpose of this change is to execute the build in stages such that the publishing of build artifacts to Azure occurs prior to running unit tests. More importantly that the status of the build reflects exactly when each stage has completed.  Once the artifacts are published this allows for other builds (aka any other workflow) dependent on those artifacts to be launched.  Given the tests and remaining process after publish take about 1 hr, 40 minutes, we can now kick off any dependent workflows that much sooner.

Evaluation builds using this pipeline have been launched from the following build definition:
https://jenkins.mono-project.com/view/Xamarin.Android/job/xamarin-android-pipe-eval/

Deployment plan (please review)
* Note: There are some open questions in the pipeline script represented by UNDONE comments, please review as these need to be resolved as part of the PR.
* Once the pipeline changes included in this PR have been approved & submitted, run pipeline evaluation test builds against master
  * Validate artifacts published to an Azure eval location are the expected artifacts (aka align with what the xamarin-android build produces) and work as expected
  * Verify all tests that are expected to run actually do so and all tests are passing (aka test results align with the xamarin-android build)
 * Verify that all expected plots are published correctly
* Once the pipeline build is verified to be working and equivalent (if not improved over) the xamarin-android build, do the following to make the pipeline build the official build for master
  * Turn off the SCM build trigger for xamarin-android and perhaps disable the build definition
  * Rename xamarin-android (freestyle) build to xamarin-android-freestyle
    * Note: We'll want to keep the freestyle build around in the near-term as a safety net that we could flip back to if needed
  * Rename xamarin-android-pipe-eval to xamarin-android (as the new official build)
    * Note: Build numbers will be reset to those using this new workflow
  * Update the build variables to publish artifacts to the expected Azure location (same location as for current xamarin-android builds)
  * Update build label in pipeline so production bots get used
  * Turn on the SCM build trigger so that builds automatically kick off with commits to origin/master
  * Update README build status link to reflect status of the pipeline build plus make any other appropriate README changes

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "[mono-sdks] Integrate with `mono:2018-04-sdks-android-standalone`" (#2096) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Merged pull request "[tests] Make the Mono.Android_TestsMultiDex run" (#2715) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
We see these errors in our jenkins builds:

    /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-android-pr-builder-release/xamarin-android/build-tools/scripts/TestApks.targets(217,5): error : Input file 'logcat-Release-Aot-Mono.Android_TestsMultiDex.txt' doesn't exist. [/Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-android-pr-builder-release/xamarin-android/tests/RunApkTests.targets]
      Build continuing because "ContinueOnError" on the task "ProcessLogcatTiming" is set to "ErrorAndContinue".

Turns out, that the reason for that is, that the
`Mono.Android_TestsMultiDex` test is not run, because no
`RunInstrumentationTests` nor `RunUITests` is used as their condition
clauses are resolved as **false**.

This is fixed by adding `TestApkInstrumentation` (and
`TestApkPermission` plus `TestApkPermission`) item groups. This makes
the test run thru the `RunInstrumentationTests` task.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[tests] cleanup DesignerTests a bit" (#2742) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: http://build.devdiv.io/2415088

In fe0ae91fd, we moved the Android designer's MSBuild targets into
this repository.

There is one test that has been randomly failing:

    DesignerTests.SetupDependenciesForDesigner

It was using the same temp directory name as
`CustomDesignerTargetSetupDependenciesForDesigner`, so the two tests
were stepping on each other.

After looking at it, the `SetupDependenciesForDesigner` just seemed
duplicative. We only had it because the designer targets weren't
present in this repo. I removed this test.

I also cleaned up the usage of:

    parameters: new [] { "DesignTimeBuild=True", "AndroidUseManagedDesignTimeResourceGenerator=False" })

All designer calls need these, so I declared the `string[]` as a
static variable.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[tests] Create test results, when processing logcat output fails" (#2740) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
It is usually hard to notice the problem, when logcat processing fails
because of the logcat file missing. Thus it will make it easier to
find, when we create `TestResults` file with an error, similar to
`RenameTestCases` task.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Make subfolders for android layout files possible" (#2741) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

It should be possible to split my layout resource files into multiple subfolders in the layout directory.
In a big application with hundreds of layout files it is currently hard to keep an overview.

In Android Studio it is always possible with some gradle modifications:
https://medium.com/mindorks/how-to-put-android-layout-files-in-subfolders-1f7cf07ff48f

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Material, WIP] Edge Treatments" (#5280) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Closed issue "OnIdiom markup extension not working properly when used to set Margin using property-element syntax." (#5279) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Using the OnIdiom markup extension to set the Margin using property-element syntax, the app worked on iPad (ver 12.1.4) but crashed on Android phone and the simulators (iPhone XS Max iOS 12.1 and Android_Accelerated_Oreo (API 27)). 

### Steps to Reproduce
Stumbled on to this when working with `<Image>`, but found it to exhibit the same behavior with `<Label>`.  So, writing with `<Label>` for simplicity.
```xaml
    <Label Text="label margin">
        <Label.Margin>
            <Thickness Left="0" Top="0" Right="0" Bottom="{OnIdiom Phone=50 Tablet=150}" />
        </Label.Margin>
    </Label>
```

### Expected Behavior
Crash on the iPad since the code is missing the `'` tag in the OnIdiom markup extension. 
`{OnIdiom Phone='50' Tablet='150'}`

### Actual Behavior
- Code works on iPad.
- Crashes the app on Android phone, iOS simulator, Android simulator.
- Not tested on an iPhone.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.5.0.129452
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Entry Border color can not be changed" (#5273) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
We have used  Entry control in  Xamarin.Forms. We need to change Entry border color but can't find any property or method to change. 
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run the attached sample Entry sample,  
2.I have changed Text and Background Color, but text border color remains black
Please suggest a way to change border color.    

### Expected Behavior
Need to change entry border color in Xamarin.Forms (Android,iOS ,UWP)

### Actual Behavior
Can't find anything related to change entry border color.

### Basic Information
- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms : 3.1.0.687729
- Last known good version: Don't Know
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017


### Reproduction Link

[EntryRenderer.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2869252/EntryRenderer.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "OnIdiom markup extension crashes app when used to set Margin using property-element syntax." (#5279) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Using the OnIdiom markup extension to set the Margin using property-element syntax, the app worked on iPad (ver 12.1.4) but crashed on Android phone and the simulators (iPhone XS Max iOS 12.1 and Android_Accelerated_Oreo (API 27)). 

### Steps to Reproduce
Stumbled on to this when working with `<Image>`, but found it to exhibit the same behavior with `<Label>`.  So, writing with `<Label>` for simplicity.
```xaml
    <Label Text="label margin">
        <Label.Margin>
            <Thickness Left="0" Top="0" Right="0" Bottom="{OnIdiom Phone=50 Tablet=150}" />
        </Label.Margin>
    </Label>
```

### Expected Behavior
Work like
```xaml
    <Label Text="label margin" Margin="{OnIdiom Phone='0,0,0,50' Tablet='0,0,0,150'}" />
```
or 
```xaml
    <Label>
        <Label.Margin>
            <OnIdiom x:TypeArguments="Thickness" Phone="0,0,0,50" Tablet="0,0,0,150" />
        </Label.Margin>
    </Label>
```
since the following code works
```xaml
    <Label Text="label margin">
        <Label.Margin>
            <Thickness Left="0" Top="0" Right="0" Bottom="10" />
        </Label.Margin>
    </Label>
```
### Actual Behavior
- Code works on iPad.
- Crashes the app on Android phone, iOS simulator, Android simulator.
- Not tested on an iPhone.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.5.0.129452
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Missing constructor on VisualElementTracker on version 3.5" (#5278) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

In version 3.5 the VisualElementTracker constructor got a 2nd optional parameter that is making libraries compiled against previous version of Xamarin.Forms to fail. This is an example of an iOS renderer that is a UIViewController:

System.MissingMethodException: Method not found: void Xamarin.Forms.Platform.iOS.VisualElementTracker..ctor(Xamarin.Forms.Platform.iOS.IVisualElementRenderer)
  at at (wrapper managed-to-native) ObjCRuntime.Messaging.IntPtr_objc_msgSendSuper(intptr,intptr)
  at UIKit.UIViewController.get_View () [0x0002a] in /Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.iOS.framework/Versions/12.2.1.13/src/Xamarin.iOS/UIKit/UIViewController.g.cs:2983
  ...

Would it be possible to add a separated 2nd constructor with 2 parameters instead of having one with an optional parameter keeping the same semantics? 

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.5
- Last known good version: 3.4

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Platform specifics: Add close button to Entry on iOS and Android" (#5277) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Added `ShowClearButton` platform specifics for Android and iOS

### API Changes ###

Added:

`Entry.On<Android>().SetShowClearButton(bool show);`
`Entry.On<iOS>().SetShowClearButton(bool show);`

### Platforms Affected ###

- iOS
- Android

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

None

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "AndroidLinkMode=Full breaks <DataTemplate/>4.0.0.135214-pre4" (#5276) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Using the full linker strips something that is causing a crash at runtime:
```
02-15 10:55:16.831 28064 28064 F         : Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.DataTemplateExtension doesn't implement interface Xamarin.Forms.Internals.IDataTemplate
--------- beginning of crash
02-15 10:55:16.831 28064 28064 F libc    : Fatal signal 6 (SIGABRT), code -6 (SI_TKILL) in tid 28064 (ex.forms.sample), pid 28064 (ex.forms.sample)
02-15 10:55:16.872 28099 28099 I crash_dump64: obtaining output fd from tombstoned, type: kDebuggerdTombstone
02-15 10:55:16.872   898   898 I /system/bin/tombstoned: received crash request for pid 28064
02-15 10:55:16.873 28099 28099 I crash_dump64: performing dump of process 28064 (target tid = 28064)
02-15 10:55:16.878 28099 28099 F DEBUG   : *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** ***
```
I have XamlC enabled and have enabled `Visual="Material"`.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build this sample in release mode: https://github.com/jonathanpeppers/glidex/tree/master/glidex.forms.sample
2. Remove `<AndroidLinkSkip>Xamarin.Forms.Core</AndroidLinkSkip>`
3. See a crash at runtime

### Expected Behavior

You shouldn't need to set `$(AndroidLinkSkip)` for Xamarin.Forms assemblies.

### Actual Behavior

Use of `ListView` and `<DataTemplate/>` seem to require `$(AndroidLinkSkip)`

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.0.0.135214-pre4
- Last known good version: at least 3.4.0.1008975 was working OK
- IDE: VS Windows 2019 P3
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - Android: 9.0
- Android Support Library Version: 28.0.0.1

### Reproduction Link

https://github.com/jonathanpeppers/glidex/tree/master/glidex.forms.sample

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Argument null exception for TextDecorations on null  strings" (#5617) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

0. iOS only
1. Model a Label bound to a string that is null such as this:
<Label x:Name="AddressLabel" Text="{Binding Business.FullAddress}" TextDecorations="Underline" />
2. Load the Form

### Expected Behavior
Form loads fine, doesn't show the label
### Actual Behavior
System.ArgumentNull exception occurs with parameter "other"
### Environment

<!--
1.
Visual Studio: Help > About Microsoft Visual Studio > Copy Info [button]
Visual Studio for Mac: Visual Studio > About Visual Studio > Show Details > Copy Information [button]
2. Paste into the code block below (between ```)
-->

```
```

### Build Logs

2. Attach build log or link to gist (https://gist.github.com/) of the log.
-->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Bump mono to head to 2018-08" (#5616) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Commit list for mono/mono:

* mono/mono@de14ec6c78e [2018-08] Add more detailed reporting for exceptions  (#13012)

Diff: https://github.com/mono/mono/compare/b0416692580d0d18fe7c87497d45e8c7398d085e...de14ec6c78e420dfd75308d8dbd9178bb56aa230

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[OpenGL] Fix MonoMacGameView .ctor when hardware acceleration isn't available" (#5614) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
- Fixes #4417: [XM] Add a `Create` method for the 'AppKit.NSOpenGLPixelFormat' type
  (https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/4417)
- Doing `new MonoMacGameView (ContentView.Frame)` on CI fails because hardware acceleration isn't available.
  One of our samples had that code: https://github.com/xamarin/mac-samples/blob/a41f4387dc28617e4207b3759617e788aad383ed/MacOpenTK/MacOpenTK/MainWindow.cs#L40
  This made some QA sample tests fail.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[XM] Add a `Create` method for the 'AppKit.NSOpenGLPixelFormat' type" (#4417) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download a [sample](https://github.com/xamarin/mac-samples/blob/master/GLSLShader)
2. Build and run it on VM

### Expected Behavior
The sample fails on the [line](https://github.com/xamarin/mac-samples/blob/master/GLSLShader/MyOpenGLView.cs#L54):
```
Could not initialize an instance of the type 'AppKit.NSOpenGLPixelFormat': the native 'init*' method returned nil.
```

If I remove `NSOpenGLPixelFormatAttribute.Accelerated` from atrributes collection it will work properly. This attribute means that an app should use hardware-accelaration only. But it doesn't exist for VM.

It also affects creating of `OpenTK.Platform.MacOS.MonoMacGameView`.

### Actual Behavior
Add a `Create` method that can return null. 

### Environment

1. VSfM
https://gist.github.com/mykyta-bondarenko-gl/abc538c727d0bd6d78a338c2f45d3f3f

### Build Logs

1. Exception
https://gist.github.com/mykyta-bondarenko-gl/ec66e97deada8ea29a5ef5170e144069

### Example Project 
[Download](https://github.com/xamarin/mac-samples/blob/master/GLSLShader)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[2018-10] dontlink tvOS crash with incremental builds or mono as a framework" (#5612) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Launch xharness, and run any of the `dont link/tvOS - device/AssemblyBuildTarget: *` tests.

### Expected Behavior

Successful test execution.

### Actual Behavior

```
Exception Type:  EXC_CRASH (SIGABRT)
Exception Codes: 0x0000000000000000, 0x0000000000000000
Exception Note:  EXC_CORPSE_NOTIFY
Termination Description: DYLD, Library not loaded: /work/maccore/mono-master/xamarin-macios/external/mono/sdks/out/ios-targettv-release/lib/libmonosgen-2.0.1.dylib | Referenced from: /private/var/containers/Bundle/Application/6677C0EC-D3CA-4117-A839-D1C83005500C/dont link.app/libmono-native-compat.dylib | Reason: image not found
Triggered by Thread:  0
```

Complete crash log: https://gist.github.com/rolfbjarne/53dd7e1b8dff1030d58035b9c17f3d75

The same tests work fine on iOS, so it's probably an if or switch somewhere that must be updated to include tvOS.

### Environment

PR #4904.

### Build Logs

https://gist.github.com/rolfbjarne/cd17b6b685e89fecf9556b27b3a9036b
